faq.question: How much can Easthampton homeowners save with solar?
faq.answer: Easthampton homeowners typically save $1,200-$2,000 annually on electricity bills. Over 25 years, that's $30,000-$50,000 in total savings. Factor in the competitive pricing ($3,900-$9,100 immediate reduction), Massachusetts SMART program payments ($20,000-$30,000 over 10 years), and annual net metering income ($1,400-$2,400), and the financial benefits are substantial.

faq.question: What solar financing is available in Easthampton?
faq.answer: Easthampton residents can choose from: (1) Solar Loans - own your system with zero-down financing, qualify for all benefits; (2) Solar Leases - fixed monthly payments with no upfront costs; (3) PPAs - pay only for electricity produced; (4) Cash Purchase - upfront payment for maximum ROI. We'll compare all options during your free consultation.

faq.question: Can I get solar with no money down in Easthampton?
faq.answer: Yes! Zero-down solar financing is widely available in Easthampton through solar loans, leases, and PPAs. Zero-down solar loans are especially popular because you own the system immediately, qualify for the competitive pricing and all financing options, and monthly payments are typically lower than current electricity costs.

faq.question: Will solar increase my property taxes in Easthampton?
faq.answer: No! Massachusetts law provides a 100% property tax exemption for solar systems for 20 years. While solar increases your Easthampton home's value by 3-4% ($15,000-$25,000 typically), you won't pay additional property taxes.

faq.question: What is the payback period for solar in Easthampton?
faq.answer: The typical payback period in Easthampton is 6-9 years, accounting for the competitive pricing, SMART program payments, net metering income, and electricity savings. After payback, solar panels continue producing free electricity for 15-20+ years.

faq.question: How does the Massachusetts SMART program work?
faq.answer: The SMART program pays Easthampton solar owners for every kWh produced for 10 years. Rates typically range from $0.25-$0.35/kWh. A 7kW residential system in Easthampton produces about 8,000-8,500 kWh annually, earning $2,000-$2,975 per year.

faq.question: What are net meterings worth in Massachusetts?
faq.answer: net metering represent 1,000 kWh of solar production, sellable at historically $200-$300. A 7kW system in Easthampton produces 7-8 net metering annually, generating $1,400-$2,400 in additional yearly income for 10-15 years.

faq.question: How does net metering work in Easthampton?
faq.answer: Net metering credits you at full retail rates for excess solar electricity sent to the grid. Credits accumulate and offset electricity purchased during nighttime or cloudy periods. Many Easthampton homeowners reduce annual costs to just the monthly connection fee.
